TORONTO, CANADA - MULTIPLE ROLES
Do you want to help change the way people understand, design for and solve the most challenging real-world design problems in their fields using a combination of Computational Science and Artificial Intelligence? Augmenta is seeking exceptional talent to help us perform research and development on complex multi-industry workflow and design automation challenges.

What you get
You will get in at the earliest stage, to help design and develop the fundamental architecture for the world’s first creative/generative AI platform. Your work will have a profound impact on complex industry challenges, and the software you write will result in new designs you will see applied in the real world.
You will be a part of an exceptional, cross-disciplinary founding team who spearheaded development and adoption of Generative Design technologies, and have delivered cutting-edge work for organizations like NASA, General Motors, Autodesk, Facebook, Royal Bank of Canada and ALDO. You will continually be in contact with and learning from cutting edge researchers and domain experts across industries.

What you will do
Research, design and implement robust, scalable mathematical models for behavioral modeling, simulation and calibration of industry workflows and processes
Investigate state-of-the-art machine learning methods by keeping abreast of bleeding-edge literature, interfacing with academic partners and attending appropriate scientific workshops/conferences
Collaborate with multidisciplinary team in multiple locations
Mentor junior staff and interns to reach their best potential

Required Qualifications
M.Sc./Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or related disciplines
Fluent in C++ and Python
Exceptional knowledge of linear algebra and calculus
Research, design and performance optimization of complex mathematical models
Ability to abstract complex parametric and non-parametric systems into representations amenable to supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods
Extensive experience with mathematical modeling/machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Torch, OpenAI API, etc.)
Extensive experience of using automated testing and continuous integration frameworks
Extensive exposure to software product development and delivery practices and related tools
Expert knowledge of API design, component architectures, principles of service-oriented software
Mathematical optimization methods, gradient estimation, Bayesian Optimization
Parallel computing methods and frameworks

Preferred Qualifications
Familiarity with fundamental Modeling & Simulation principles and methods
Mathematical optimization methods
Numerical methods for solving partial differential equations problems
Interactive 3D graphics and data visualization
Distributed computing
GPU acceleration of numerical algorithms using CUDA/OpenCL
Amazon Web Services APIs

About us
Augmenta is an early stage startup founded by industry veterans and pioneers of novel design methods and technologies, building design automation tools that empower designers, engineers and planners to solve the most complex problems in their fields.
Starting with people’s goals & inspiration our systems use AI and computational techniques to explore thousands of possible designs - developing solutions that far outperform what anyone could create on their own. We're changing the way we fundamentally understand and solve problems with AI as our design partner.
Our goal is to create a world where the extremely difficult problems that face humankind are regularly solved through a completely new holistic way of thinking about and seeing the world, and a strong combination of artificial intelligence, simulation, strategy, empathy and human centered design.
Our vision is to be the place where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, to stay and do their best work. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, identity, orientation, age or disability.

Interested?
Send a Resume and Cover letter to:
careers@augmenta.ai

job_title: agileDSS - Practice Lead : Cloud Analytics / Snowflake
job_description:
Description de l'emploi
Responsable de Pratique Cloud Analytique (Snowflake)
Nous sommes à la recherche d’un(e) Directeur de Pratique Cloud Analytique avec une connaissance particulière sur Snowflake pour rejoindre notre équipe de conseillers en analytique avancé et travailler sur des projets innovants avec nos clients. Nos conseillers travaillent pour les plus grandes entreprises québécoises sur des projets à moyen ou long terme et chez nous hors de question de travailler en silo: on partage nos projets, nos compétences et notre savoir-faire au quotidien.
agileDSS, c’est quoi/qui ?
agileDSS est une entreprise de service-conseil spécialisée en analytique avancé. Depuis 15 ans, nous accompagnons les grandes entreprises québécoises à tirer le meilleur parti de leurs données par le biais d’une expertise de pointe en analytique avancé (Big Data, Intelligence d’Affaires, Visualisation de Données et Data Science).
Ce poste est pour toi si tu as :
3 projets en Architecture / développement Snowflake à ton actif
Expérience en design et modélisation de solutions analytiques
Expérience en développement en implémentation de solutions de base de données relationnelles : Azure SQL / Azure Synapse (Azure SQL DW)
Expérience en développement en implémentation de solutions de données non-relationnelles : Cosmos DB
Expérience en ingestion de données batch et streaming : Data Factory / Stream Analytics
Expérience en gestion d'équipe à titre de référent technique
Connaissances des services Azure : blob storage, data lake storage, Logic Apps, Azure Databricks
Connaissance dans l'utilisation d'outils de CI/CD : DevOps, Git;
Connaissance de différents outils Big Data parmi les suivants: Spark / Kafka;
Connaissance des différentes plateformes cloud : Azure
Connaissance et expérience dans les environnements Unix.
Curiosité, excellent relationnel, créativité, force de proposition
Avoir le goût du challenge et l'envie de réussir. Passionné par ce que vous faites
Maitrise écrit / oral français et anglais
Expérience en architecture de solutions Big Data ou data warehousing - ATOUT
Expérience en Intelligence d'affaires au niveau modélisation et/ou développement backend - ATOUT
Posséder la connaissance et l’expérience des différents processus, méthodologies et techniques de développement Agile - ATOUT
Connaissances de plusieurs domaines d'affaires: Multimédia, Télécommunications, Énergie, Distribution, Jeux Vidéos, Spectacles, etc. - ATOUT
Mais les hard skills c’est pas tout !
Avant toute chose on cherche un nouveau collègue qui va s’épanouir dans notre environnement! Si tu es une personne qui aime partager ses connaissances, qui prône le self-management, qui est bienveillant, fun et gourmande, tu as de grandes chances de te plaire chez nous !
À quoi tu peux t’attendre dans ton rôle de Responsable de Pratique :
Connaître, comprendre et communiquer la stratégie de l'entreprise avec un prisme technologique
Définir les grilles d’évaluation technique pour les candidats Cloud Analytique
Réaliser les entrevues techniques
Montée en compétence et mentorat des employés
Gérer les besoins en formation
Veille technologique : anticiper les tendances technologiques en fonction du marché cible
Anticiper via un roadmap la réponse du marché local
Participer aux appels d'offre avec un axe technique notamment en estimant les projets
Participer à l'élaboration et au développement de l'offre de service Cloud Analytique
Pré-ventes : rencontrer les clients, comprendre les besoin d'affaire et les traduire en projets techniques
Être en lien avec les partenaires technologiques, notamment Snowflake
À quoi tu peux t’attendre dans ton rôle de spécialiste Snowflake :
Élabore l’architecture de données et de solutions;
Développement et ingénierie de données sur les services de données Azure;
Analyse des besoins utilisateurs;
Participation aux ateliers de collecte de besoin;
Apprentissage continu des nouveaux outils et frameworks de développement avec du temps y étant dédié;
Participe au processus d’assurance qualité;
Participe à la présentation des livrables au client sur la partie technique, avant, pendant et après les projets;
Coach et oriente les juniors et intermédiaires au sein des projets;
Agit comme facilitateur au sein de projets analytiques avec les clients;
Conseille et oriente les analystes et les développeurs sur la partie technique.
Ce qu’on t’offre
Nous sommes avant tout une équipe de collaborateurs à taille humaine qui a à coeur le bien-être de ses employés, c’est pourquoi nous t’offrons:
Une rémunération annuelle fixe et une bonification annuelle selon l’atteinte de ta performance
Des objectifs individuels accessibles et réalistes pour garantir un environnement sans pression
Des assurances collectives Manuvie (dentaire, vision, soins paramédicaux…)
4 semaines de vacances
Remboursement des abonnements de sport et du transport
Horaires flexibles et télétravail
Plan de développement pour chaque employé et coaching avec un mentor
Environnement non hiérarchique favorisant l’intrapreneuriat
Activités mensuelles de team building
Abonnement au spa
Compétences requises
Cloud Analytique 5 à 10 ans
Architecture ETL / Back-end 10 ans ou plus
Snowflake 1 à 2 ans
Compétences en gestion 3 à 5 ans
Pré-ventes 3 à 5 ans
Microsoft Synapse 1 à 2 ans
Business Intelligence 5 à 10 ans
Big Data 1 à 2 ans
-
Job description
We are looking for a Cloud Analytics Practice Manager with specific knowledge of Snowflake to join our team of advanced analytics consultants and work on innovative projects with our clients. Our consultants work for the largest Quebec companies on medium- or long-term projects, and at agileDSS, we refuse to work in silos: we share our projects, skills and know-how on a daily basis.
Who is agileDSS?
agileDSS is a consulting firm specializing in advanced analytics. For 15 years, we have been helping Quebec’s largest companies to make the most of their data with our expertise in advanced analytics (Big Data, Business Intelligence, Data Visualization and Data Science).
This job is for you if you have:
Completed at least 3 projects in Snowflake architecture/development
Experience in designing and modeling analytical solutions
Development experience in implementing relational database solutions: Azure SQL/Azure Synapse (Azure SQL DW)
Development experience in implementing NoSQL database solutions: Cosmos DB
Experience in batch and streaming data management: Data Factory/Stream Analytics
Experience in team management as a technical referent
Knowledge of Azure services: blob storage, data lake storage, Logic Apps, Azure Databricks
Knowledge in the use of CI/CD tools: DevOps, Git
Knowledge of various Big Data tools, including Spark and Kafka
Knowledge of different cloud platforms: Azure
Knowledge and experience of Unix environments
Curiosity, good interpersonal skills, creativity and proactiveness
A taste for challenge and the desire to succeed, and a strong passion for what you do
Proficiency in written and oral French and English
Experience in Big Data or data warehousing solutions architecture - ASSET
Experience in Business Intelligence at the modeling and/or backend development level - ASSET
Knowledge and experience of the various Agile development processes, methodologies and techniques - ASSET
Knowledge of several business areas: Multimedia, Telecommunications, Energy, Distribution, Video games, Entertainment, etc. - ASSET
But there is more to it than hard skills!
Most of all, we are looking for a new colleague who will grow in our environment! If you are a person who likes to share his/her knowledge, who advocates self-management, who is benevolent, fun and enjoys food, you will surely like it here at agileDSS!
What you can expect in your role as a Practice Manager:
Learn, understand and communicate the company’s strategy through a technological prism
Prepare technical evaluation grids for cloud analytics candidates
Carry out technical interviews
Provide skills development opportunities and coaching to employees
Manage training needs
Technology watch: anticipate technological trends based on the target market
Anticipate reactions on the local market via a roadmap
Participate in calls for tenders from a technical point of view, in particular by estimating projects
Participate in the development of the cloud analytics service offer
Pre-sales: meet clients, understand business needs and translate them into technical projects
Stay in touch with technological partners, especially Snowflake
What you can expect in your role as a Snowflake specialist:
Develop the data and solution architecture
Develop and engineer data using Azure data services
Analyze users’ needs
Participate in needs collection workshops
Have dedicated time to continuously learn new development tools and frameworks
Participate in the quality assurance process
Participate in the presentation of technical deliverables to the client before, during and after projects
Coach and guide juniors and intermediates who work on projects
Act as a facilitator on analytical projects with clients
Advise and guide analysts and developers on all technical aspects
What we have to offer:
We are above all a human-sized company who takes the well-being of its employees at heart, which is why we offer you:
A fixed annual compensation and a performance-based annual bonus
Accessible and realistic individual goals to guarantee a pressure-free day-to-day environment
Manuvie group insurance (dental care, eye care, paramedical care, etc.)
4 weeks of paid vacation
Reimbursement of sporting and transportation fees
Flexible work schedules and telework
A development plan for every employee and mentoring
A non-hierarchical environment that promotes intrapreneurship
Monthly team building activities
A spa membership
Required skills
Cloud Analytics 5 to 10 years
Back-end architecture 10 years or more
Snowflake 1 to 2 years
Management skillset 3 to 5 years
Pre-sale 3 to 5 years
Microsoft Synapse 1 to 2 years
Business Intelligence 5 to 10 years

job_title: SOLUTION AND DATA ARCHITECT BI AND AZURE
job_description:
Job Type
Full-time
Location
Montreal, Quebec
Availability
Immediate
Remuneration
Experience Based Salary + Benefits
Essence of the role:
We are looking for a Data Scientist who will be providing consulting services to our customers as a Data Scientist. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action for a variety of business functions and industries. The candidate must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. The candidate must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. He/She must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.
Responsibilities:
Work with our customers’ stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging their data and produce insights, allowing them to improve business processes or even innovate by changing the industry.
ML/DL using customers’ data (including data lakes) to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing, supply chains, services, operations, manufacturing, R&D or any other relevant business functions.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets when needed. Reuse existing algorithms when they do the job.
Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
Make the model transparent and unbiased.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.
Keep up to date with auto AI to improve cycle time on features engineering.
Keep up to date with various AI toolkits to improve cycle time.
A talent for operating effectively at various levels of abstraction.
An aptness to distill complex, technical topics articulately to a non-technical audience.
Adaptability, flexibility and an ability to navigate ambiguity.
Requirements:
Strong business processes / objectives understanding skills.
Strong understanding of the relationships of data with business processes (SIPOC, CRUD, etc).
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
SPSS experience.
Watson Studio and Watson ML experience.
Experience with ready to use AI models from Watson, AWS, GC and Azure.
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.
Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers: Google Analytics, Site Catalyst, Coremetrics, Adwords, Crimson Hexagon, Facebook Insights, etc.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
We’re looking for someone with 5-7 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, has a Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field.
Experience working with data architectures.
Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, SLQ, etc.
Experience with Redshift, S3, Spark, Databricks, Cloudera, Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, MySQL, etc.
Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using a variety of software.
Bilingual (French & English).
What will make you successful at KPI Digital
A desire to be accountable for owning problems from design to implementation.
An understanding of the difference between data and useful insights.
A bias for action and pragmatic solutions.
A low ego and humility; an ability to gain trust through effective communication and doing what you say you will do.
Benefits:
The opportunity to join and grow an ever-expanding professional network of high-profile clients and reputable colleague
A passionate and approachable leadership team that encourages an entrepreneurial frame of mind and welcomes contribution to business development from all members of the team
An unparalleled opportunity to gain in depth operational experience across a variety of industries and organizational departments
The opportunity to explore and put into practice cutting edge technology on a regular basis
Competitive merit-based compensation and bonus packages that rapidly reward passionate and driven team members
Small company culture, with big company benefits: Group Insurance: Health, Dental, Travel, Life, more
Free use of gym within building
Full kitchen with snacks, treats, espresso, etc.
Easy access to public transportation and free parking
Casual work environment
Who is KPI Digital?
KPI Digital has been helping clients meet their revenue goals for over 30 years. We specialize in Digital Transformation, Analytics & AI and Performance Management business solutions/services. More specifically Analytics, Digital Marketing, Big Data, Insights, Customer 360, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning and Internet of Things (IOT). In addition, we offer Consulting Services, Managed Services, Packaged Services, Education and Training.
Are you seeking a new opportunity where you can make an impact and be recognized and compensated for your achievements? If this sounds intriguing, consider KPI Digital for your career, apply now!

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.

Department Overview

The Digital Data and Analytics (DDA) group is looking for highly motivated and driven individuals to join a team of analytics implementation specialists in a fast-paced environment supporting multiple digital & mobile platforms and applications across many lines of business within TD Bank Financial Group (Canada & U.S.)

Reporting into the Manager of Measurement Solutions, this position is accountable for implementation, continued integration and knowledge transfer of our analytics stack including Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Adobe Audience Manager, Adobe Launch, Adobe Mobile Services and Ensighten.

As a whole, the DDA team is responsible for extracting business and customer value from digital data. We provide automated reporting and visualization to business partners, and use advanced analytics, data science and machine learning to build data-driven solutions to deliver richer, more connected personalized experiences to our customers.

Within DDA, the Measurement Solutions team is responsible for managing and enhancing the analytics capabilities of TD Bank digital & mobile projects, ad-hoc tagging requests and marketing support with best-in-class measurement strategies.

Job Description

Collaborate with our digital stakeholders to define KPIs, reporting requirements, and overall measurement strategy for our digital and mobile customer journeys
Translate business requirements into technical specifications for custom digital analytics implementation using a combination of data layer, processing rules, SAINT classification, report suite configuration, custom JavaScript, JSON and applicable integrations with other systems
Manage daily operations and implementation of TD's analytics stack (Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Adobe Audience Manager, Adobe Launch, Adobe Mobile Services, Ensighten) and 3rd party marketing tags (DoubleClick, Rakuten, Facebook, etc.)
Develop and own all implementation documents such as SDR, Data Layer specifications, custom JavaScript
Ensure the timely delivery and accuracy of documentation and technical coding (HTML, JavaScript, ActionScript) via our Tag Management System
Collaborate with technology teams on implementation of analytics solutions, including guidance on data layer implementation and troubleshooting, data feeds and integrations with other systems
Keep abreast of product updates (Adobe, Ensighten), best practices and proactively follow up with required changes in our implementation and appropriate communications
Provide consultative service, training and validation support to quality assurance/testing teams.

Job Requirements

4+ years' experience in analytics, with digital experience preferred
5+ years' experience of web development including JavaScript, jQuery and Angular
Strong understanding of JSON structures and best practices
Strong understanding of Native Mobile development standards
Strong understanding of JavaScript & Node.js & DOM manipulation, web markup, including HTML5 and CSS3
Expertise with tag management tools (DTM, Adobe Launch, Tealium, Ensighten) and their configuration
All-hands experience in implementing/troubleshooting/deploying the Adobe stack, Google 360 and/or 3rd party marketing tags using DTM or Adobe Launch or Ensighten
Expert level knowledge in developing Adobe Analytics Solution Design Reference (SDR)
Understanding of Adobe Analytics processing rules, SAINT classifications, report suite configuration, and data feeds
Experience architecting a Data Layer Specification and guiding the development team on implementation and troubleshooting
Experience debugging Adobe Analytics utilizing browser network calls, extensions, and tools such as Fiddler, Charles or Omnibug
Ability to own and work independently on assigned deliverables, but also collaborate with multiple team members and stakeholders when necessary
Solid communications skills – verbal and written
Strong time-management skills and ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
